Name: Monopoly: Atletico Madrid
Description:
A Monopoly about the Club Atlético de Madrid established in 1903.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend the money in the official store.

Roll the dice and move around the board thanks to the pawns and travel through the best of the history of Atletico Madrid -  stadiums, best players, and the great victories in team history.


¡Conviértete en un exitoso manager de uno de los clubs de fútbol más importantes de Europa!
 ¡Con el divertido Monopoly del Atlético de Madrid! Prepárate para un emocionante viaje por los mejores lugares y momentos del club de la capital, invierte en gradas y estadios para derrotar a tus rivales y convertirte en el dueño de todo. 
¡Negocia tu camino al éxito con el juego de las propiedades más famoso y genial! 
¡En esta ocasión junto al club de tus amores, el Atletico de Madrid!

Descubre el resto de emocionantes versiones del clásico Monopoly, encuentra versiones clásicas, modernas, de tus series favoritas y mucho más.

Name: Dinner for One
Description:
"Same procedure as last year, Miss Sophie?"
"Same procedure as every year, James!"

Well, not quite. Miss Sophie is once again celebrating her 90th birthday with her deceased friends, but in the party game Der 90. Geburtstag oder Dinner for One based on the cult sketch of the same name, the players take turns playing the role of the butler James and reenacting the scenes: Saying toasts to the birthday child, hitting the heels, and serving food and drink — including, of course, jumping over the tiger's head, along with an increasing physical handicap through cardboard bottles clamped in the crooks of the arm or between the thighs because the increasingly drunk state of James cannot be missing in this party game.

The scenes are revealed as cards in a random order. As the game progresses, more and more cards are added, but the round always starts with the first card, followed by the second, and so on, so you should memorize the "script" in the game or else you will collect penalty chips.

In the end, whoever has the fewest Schwips-Chips wins. "Skol!"

—description from the publisher

Name: Broadside:  Empires of Steel
Description:
Broadside:  Empires of Steel is a fully printable tabletop miniatures game set in the era of the Dreadnought Battleship.

The game is designed for fast, action-packed games between fleets consisting of roughly 7 to 12 ships per side.

The rules allow you to play a game of six turns in a couple of hours with decisive results. They are also designed to be fun, without the need for consulting vast numbers of tables to find out what is happening to your ships.

The game has a Quick Play Rule book, a mission book and five Fleet List books.
The Mission book has twelve missions, six that use objective miniatures and are narrative and six that are designed for fleet battles. The fleet list books help you construct fleets. All the ships have a corresponding card. On this ship card are points to ensure even sided games can be played if your not looking to re-create historical encounters.

2021 has seen the release of the Three Crowns expansion giving players ships and fleet books for Italy and Austria-Hungary. The Kickstarter also unlocked other lists and ships for The Empire of Great Britain, the Empire of Germany and the U.S. Navy.

September 2021 will see the third release for Broadside EOS called Hunting Grounds. This expansion will add the Imperial Russian Navy, new missions, token STL's, aircraft, submarines, upgrade cards, aircraft carriers and a fort.

The game has 116 ships STL's so far.

Name: Ophidian 2360: Promo Pack 3
Description:
This promo pack contains 3 Gladiators, 3 Minions, 1 Quick-Hit & 2 Pumps

014 Mark of Xan
015 NecroTek Mangler
016 Assault Drone
017 Anima L1/L2
018 Dark Scry L1/L2
019 Stinger L1/L2
020 Helix Striker
021 Steel Blitz
022 Sutama's Core

Name: Tribu de Sinvergüenzas
Description:
Tribu de Sinvergüenzas is a drinking game in which you will face three types of challenges: Indictment, Social Defiance, and WTF Questions.

If you dare, you must accuse others, respond with truth, or share the challenge.

At game's end, the player with the most points is expelled from the tribe, while the player with the fewest is named Head of the Scoundrel Tribe and winner of this game.

Name: MOD-BOTS
Description:
MOD-BOTS is a 3D printable game where players assemble their robots from a variety of interchangeable pieces with matching dice. The base game includes four heads, four bodies, four legs, and eight arms. This allows for over 2000 unique combinations of MOD-BOT parts!

Players choose three of their available dice to roll and then compares symbols on the dice. Shields cancel Hits, while Skulls are hits that cannot be canceled. The player who takes the most hits loses one of their dice and must remove a part from their MOD-BOT. The piece isn't lost forever though, it goes to the scrapyard with other extra parts, where it could be regained by either player when rolling a Repair symbol. When only one player has any remaining dice, they win!

Name: The Apocalypse of Darkness Warfare
Description:
The Evil Spirits are coming! You must work together to fight the Demons and seal the Darkness Channel to send them back to the void. Meanwhile, you have to search for the crucial artifacts, “Divine Cloak” and “Staff of Desire,” to revive Mo-Niang’s spirit so that you can stand a chance to defeat the ultimate Boss and save the world!

The Apocalypse of Darkness Warfare is a cooperative card game based on a popular comics book of the same name in Taiwan. You will play as the leading characters in the story and search for the crucial artifacts to revive the legendary Goddess Mo-Niang and defeat the Demons.

In this game, player take turns to do the following:
1. Draw 2 cards from the deck. If a Demon is drawn, place it in front of you.
2. Perform as many actions as you wish, including:
 (1) Play an Item card to execute its effect (e.g., Search)
 (2) Play Action cards to defeat Demons in front of you
 (3) Activate your special ability or equipped Items

Players need to also search the Resolution deck to collect all artifacts so that they can revive Mo-Niang's spirit. Therefore, they have a chance to defeat the Boos and win the game!

Name: Crosswords
Description:
Crosswords is a word game in the spirit of Scrabble, on a unique grid and with some options that make it a different (and more interesting) game.


     The board is an octagon-diamond grid, where the octagons hold the letters, and randomly selected intermediate diamonds indicate letter or word bonuses.  
     Bonuses not always in the same places, and score for each letter placed adjacent to them.
     Octagons instead of squares, allow diagonal words to be visualized..


Words can be restricted to the traditional horizontal and vertical directions, or diagonal words can be allowed.  Other options include playing "backwards" words, and playing multiple connected words at once.

All combined, Crosswords is a lot more varied and strategic than Scrabble.  The variable
number and position of the bonuses, and the multiple use of bonuses, makes play a lot more
variable.    Likewise, allowing backwards and diagonal words unclogs the grid, which can
expand in any direction.

Name: A Penchant For Potion
Description:
2-4 alchemists compete to match the most potions by shape in their apothecary. Discard cards from your hands to perform to perform actions such as breaking other player's potions, drawing cards, adding broken potions from the discard, and much more. Can you brew a win against opposing alchemists? 
Gameplay Rules
-Separate the potions from the Action Cards
-Shuffle the deck of 40 potion cards and pass out 6 cards to each player (this is your hand), then place the remaining cards facedown in a reachable area; this is the deck
-Pass out 1 Action Card to each player
-The player who most recently watched a movie about magic goes first
-Each player can perform up to as many actions as they can (except breaking potions and preventing breaking potions) by discarding cards from their hand (this will be listed on the Action Card)
-When a player uses a Placement action, set the Potion facedown in front of you; this area is known as the Apothecary (a player can have as many potions as possible in their Apothecary)
-When your turn ends, draw 2 cards (there is no hand limit)
-The player who can match 5 of the same potion shapes in their Apothecary wins OR the player with the most matching potion shapes in their potion shape sets (see Note section) in their Apothecary when the deck has expired twice wins.

-description from designer

Name: Crazy Atomic Windup Robots
Description:
A tactical opponent for miniature wargames.

Crazy Atomic Windup Robots is a card deck to imbue a solitary game opponent with a strategy and to animate the maneuver, organization, and attack of its units.

The rules feature a deck of 90 cards that aid the solo player, cooperative players, or gamemaster in a miniature wargamer. If your dissatisfied with your own meta thinking during solo play, randomness of dice bots, or use of flow charts then consider trying out this deck. You will need to track the opponent’s units, follow prompts to evaluate criteria, and draw cards to determine the opponent’s reaction.  We think this deck will help preserve your sense of uncertainty and maintain your wargaming immersion.

Included are cards for two decks and a series of event cards. The first is the General Reaction deck that directs the opponent at the start of the game and in the face of uncertainty. The second is the Enemy Visible that will direct opponent when its units are in contact with your units. Finally, the Event cards will help customize play as you want to change your game.

The rules are designed for a simple assessment criterion. A simple sample game is provided in the instructions with a walk through of three full turns.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Valencia CF
Description:
Show that you are the best, with the exclusive edition of Monopoly Valencia CF.
     Live the life of a great manager in the fast-paced world of professional sports. Put yourself in the shoes of a successful Valencia CF manager.
     Now you have the possibility to show your Valencianismby playing a game of Monopoly with this official edition of Valencia CF.
     Property Titles: all values are the same as their equivalents in classic Monopoly
     The four corners do not change, as does the way to win: the player who remains after the rest of the players have been ruined, wins the game
     The stations and services boxes now include: Bus, Official Stores, Changing Room, Sports City, Valencia CF Tour and Mestalla Stadium
     The houses and hotels are now stands and stadiums




     Demuestra que eres el mejor con la edición exclusiva de Monopoly Valencia CF.
     Vive la vida de un gran gestor en el vertiginoso mundo del deporte profesional. Ponte en el lugar de un exitoso manager del Valencia CF.
     Ahora tienes la posibilidad de demostrar tu valencianismo, jugando una partida de Monopoly con esta edicioÌn oficial del Valencia CF. 
     TiÌtulos de Propiedad: todos los valores son iguales a los de sus equivalentes en el claÌsico Monopoly
     Las cuatro esquinas no cambian, al igual que el modo de ganar: el jugador que se mantenga una vez el resto de jugadores se hayan arruinado, gana el juego
     Las casillas de estaciones y servicios incluyen ahora: AutobuÌs, Tiendas O ciales, Vestuario, Ciudad Deportiva, Tour Valencia CF y Estadio de Mestalla
     Las casas y hoteles ahora son gradas y estadios

Name: Monopoly: D-Day – 06.06.1944
Description:
With Monopoly D-Day, take part in the greatest military operation of all time! 
Invest the highly strategic places and lay your foundations to become the hero of Operation Overlord! 
Monopoly D-DAY 06/06/1944: board game where the goal is to be the last player not to go bankrupt. 
Bilingual French and English game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Avec le Monopoly D-Day, participez à la plus grande opération militaire de tous les temps ! 
Investissez les lieux hautement stratégiques et posez vos jalons pour devenir le héros de l'opération Overlord ! Monopoly D-DAY 06/06/1944 : jeu de société où le but est d'être le dernier joueur à ne pas faire faillite. 
Jeu bilingue Français et Anglais !

—description from the publisher

Name: Fruit Salad: The Multiple Games in One Game
Description:
Fruit Salad is a card game that has multiple games in one. Fruit Salad functions as a collection of games and a tool to make new games using the same pieces. The games vary from,


     Simple games easy for younger gamers and still entertaining for more experienced gamers.



     Fast paced games that throw out the idea of taking turns for a fun free -for-all style .



     Games that challenge gamers by making them face off with other gamers in a game of wits.


The kind of games Fruit Salad contains is limitless. Fruit Salad is a fun, colorful game that helps fill the need for all sorts of gamers.

—description from the designer

Name: Take Me Home
Description:
Help an animal from a zoo back to its natural habitat. This is a charming children's game with an environmental and animal conservation theme. It teaches children the shape of the world and its continents, different means of travelling and places where certain animals live.

The aim of the game: In zoos all over the world animals are being bred in captivity in order to re-populate the areas where these species live in the wild. What the players have to do is transport the animals from the different zoos to their natural habitats and set them free.

Play is completed with a roulette wheel, animal, and transport cards on a board with specific routes which must be matched to the type of transport.

—user summary

Name: Grand jeu du Tour de France
Description:
To go around the Tour while having fun, here is the official game of the Tour de France!
Take your turn, with your family and on a stage, the most popular summer sporting event in France!

Find with this family game a friendly atmosphere and everything that has made the success of the Tour de France for more than 100 years: the sport, the performances, but also the knowledge of France and its rich heritage that the event gives us ( re) discover.
You will progress on the plateau, 21 key stages to score points, become the yellow jersey and win the Tour de France on an ideal course traced by the Aso and punctuated with questions putting you to the test !!!

The goal of the game:
Wear the yellow jersey upon arrival on the Champs-Elysées.

Gameplay:
To finish the yellow jersey, you have to total the most points.
Each step puts you to the test with the questions that the luck of the dice will designate you.

How to score points?
Depending on the type of question, the number of points is not always the same, it varies from 1 to 3.

Categories:
1. The runners: bio - prize list - nicknames - managers - feats of arms - sponsors - teams
2. The stages: passes - descents - turns - arrivals - towns - first times - the essentials - legendary editions
3. The race: jerseys - organization and organizers - records - strategy - classification - equipment
4. Culture: expressions and slang - tour personalities - journalists - writers - artists - politicians - the media - audience - historical events
5. La France du Tour: history - geography - heritage - gastronomy
6. On top / Failure: challenges and bonuses or penalties

Name: Le Grand Jeu du Tour de France
Description:
Le Grand Jeu du Tour de France
A game for all Tour de France lovers.

Become a Tour champion for a game and escape the peloton by answering the "Tour" questions and the "France" questions, divided into three categories:

     Sprint (all players can answer)
     Time Trial (15 or 30 seconds to give a series of answers)
     Breakaway (the player is the only one to answer).


Along the way, find the heroes who wrote the legend of the Great Loop, relive their exploits and put your name on the prize list by showing yourself up to the challenges offered by our 21 "Stages" boxes!

Name: QA-CODE
Description:
In this game, players use theme cards to create a quiz for their friends. 
Using 4 hints, you will need to get just the right number of people to guess the answer to your quiz correctly.

Name: Monster Busters
Description:
Furious monsters are storming the kingdom. The calling for the braveness assembles a team of fearless adventurers, and you are one of them! However, some of the monsters seem to be… well, too furious to be handled properly (without killing you!). Should you fight at all costs? Or should you strategically retreat to survive a bit longer?

In Monster Busters, you and your fellow adventurers try to defeat the monsters as a team. In each round, each player must play one card from their hand to fight or retreat. If your collective attack is strong enough, you can defeat the monster and gain valuable Items and victory points. But, if the battle is lost, you will be buried with just a little sympathy (VP).
So, the adventurer’s dilemma is: Should I fight bravely for glory at the risk of dying, or cower at the right time to live longer to enjoy the even sweeter triumph at the end of the game?

Name: PixBlocks
Description:
PixBlocks serves as tool for the development of programming and imagination. By solving the tasks, the player builds a program that is executed by a moving rabbit. A job well done - getting the rabbit to eat the carrots - is a well-written program. The game includes tasks for both single and many players. Quests have different levels of difficulty.

Gra sÅ‚uÅ¼y rozwojowi wyobraÅºni programistycznej. RozwiÄ…zujÄ…c zadania, gracz buduje program, który jest wykonywany przez poruszajÄ…cego siÄ™ królika. Dobrze wykonane zadanie – doprowadzenie królika do marchewek – to dobrze napisany program. Gra zawiera zadania zarówno dla jednego gracza, jak i dla kilku. Zadania majÄ… róÅ¼ny poziom trudnoÅ›ci.

Name: Eletrika
Description:
In Brazil, a great amount of energy is produced by hydroelectricity. Dams are responsible for providing energy to industries, markets, and houses across the country. This electricity is distributed by great networks of transmission. It's a big business that moves billions every year.

Elétrica invites you and your friends to take on the role of energy entrepreneurs. During the game, you need to increase the size of the map and construct lines to supply energy to cities. With each new line, you can complete contracts and receive victory points.

In more detail, following a set-up phase in which you each place a tile next to the starting spring river tile, on a turn you either (1) reveal and place a new tile or (2) build. The tile-laying works as you might expect, with tiles needing to be adjacent with the elements on each side matching. After placing a tile, you can place a marker on it to reserve it.

The game includes five types of constructions — hydroelectric, electrical substation, transmission tower, utility pole, and city — and to build one of them, you use workers on a tile and choose an available construction, following certain limitations on building. A hydroelectric construction must be placed on a tile with water, for example, while a city can't be built next to a transmission tower and three constructions can't be neighbors to one another on a triangle of tiles. When you build a functioning network, you can complete a contract and score points. Two constructions of the same type earns you 2 points, for example, while more complex combinations earn you more.

Once the final tile is revealed and placed, the game ends and whoever has the most points becomes an energy magnate!

Name: Lonely Undead
Description:
The life of a zombie can be a lonely one. Like anyone, zombies crave companionship. It's just too bad that their main friendship-making techniques involve such force. But hey, it beats dying alone!

Lonely Undead is a survival board game that pits (very recently infected) zombies (Zs) head-to-head against a small-town of wannabe heroes, innocent bystanders, and other freshly turned Zs. Each player embodies a different Z with its own distinct set of special abilities and styles fitting to their character. If the characters can be harnessed effectively depends on a number of factors, for this is no push over town and you're not the only one out seeking friends.

Plan and navigate your way about town and find some people to bite! Whilst doing so, look for supplies to aid your cause, but be careful who you walk up on. You might not always enjoy who you discover. Your targets are The Living and are revealed upon engagement. Each Living has its own set of attributes and bonuses that you have to try to beat. If they're stronger than you, hope that chance is on your side.

Watch out for other Zs trying to foil your plans! 
Other Zs will do their best to try to keep you from infecting your new buddies. How rude. Let's hope they can't stop you.

Then the Town gets its turn!
After you've caused some mayhem, the Town retaliates. Apparently they don't like being preyed upon and bodies lying in the streets. Draw your reactions, suffer the consequences, and watch out for cars and dogs!

Be the first Z to infect so many of the Living to become the winner!

Many other game modes!
Lonely Undead comes complete with many other game modes. Team up and try your (severed) hand in a Co-op mode or run amok on the streets alone in a Solo mode.

Build a different town every time!
Lonely Undead comes complete with modular tiles of the towns structures. In the "Mutated" Mode, players can build the town based off of their goals before they even set foot into it.

55 different Aids cards to help your cause!
30 different Living to encounter!
55 distinct Reactions from the town!
Six unique Zs to play as!
Three main game modes with multiple difficulties and objectives!
A customizable modular town system!
Lonely Undead is a game with infinite possibilities. Never play the same game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Celtic Legends Edition
Description:
Tour the unique history of Celtic FC, from its establishment in 1888 and winning their first ever match — against Rangers FC — to today's successful side.

Tour the board and buy legends from the Celtic FC and other football greats plus current players and managers. Build stands then upgrade to stadium and watch the rent come pouring in. Take your chances with Home and Away cards as you tour the board as one of the classic football Monopoly tokens.

Choose your favourite token, tour your favourite players and managers and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for agent fees, jail and bankruptcy.

Advance to Jock Stein, Artur Boruc and Henrik Larrson — will you owe rent or reap the rewards?

Build stands and stadium and trade your way to success.

Name: スーパーバニーカンパニー (Super Bunny Company)
Cataclysm: Battle Scenarios – Volume X: A Panzer Korps Module
Description:
PANZER KORPS BATTLE SCENARIOS Volume X is the Tenth in a series of Scenario books designed specifically for the PANZER KORPS WWII Rules System. 
16 ready to play Scenarios featuring larger and more challenging scenarios with maps & Force Groups. 
Scenarios included: 

     A Savage Storm: Breakout at Mtzensk ‘41
     Battle for the Uryv Bridgehead ‘42
     Battle for Aprilia ‘44 
     Clash of Armor ’44 
     Battle for Kecskemet ‘44 
     Battle of Dnov ‘41 
     Relief of Stalingrad ‘42 
     Bremoncourt ‘44 
     Siege Of Hong Kong ‘41 
     Kharkov ‘42 
     Nordic Fist ‘41 
     Battle of Le Cateau ‘40 
     Operation Grozny ‘42 
     Operation Zitadelle ‘43 
     Last Panzer Victory ‘45 
     Operation Epsom ‘44


—description from the publisher's website
Families: Series: Panzer Korps Miniature Wargame (Hoplite Research Games)

Name: Kodama Forest: Decrees Promo Pack
Description:
This is a set of 15 decree cards to be used with Kodama Forest.

"An exclusive item for Kickstarter backers with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.

If you want to add variety to Kodama Forest, you can choose to play with one of these decrees.  Decrees add special rules that change the way the game is played.

To use the decrees, simply shuffle all of the decrees facedown, and then have a player draw one faceup and read it to the rest of the players.  For the rest of the game, the rule introduced by this decree will be in effect."

—description from the publisher

Name: Chaudron Party
Description:
Chaudron Party is a family game in which sorcerers explore the forest to find ingredients to concoct potions and score points. 
Each turn, a player reveals cards and pushes his luck: he can win Ingredient cards if he is able to reveal identical cards and if he reveals less than three different ingredients or less than two Dead-end cards.
When a player can get the right ingredients to match a Potion card, then he can choose to concoct a potion, say the magic formula and score the points of the Potion card won.
When a player reaches 7 points, we finish the round and the game ends. The player with the most points is declared Grand Sorcerer of the night!

—description from the publisher

Name: Terror by the Lake
Description:
It’s going to be a great weekend. A group of 5 friends are going to spend a fun weekend at the lake. Little do they know but there is a 6th guest that will be dropping by...

You are an undead killer that happens to come across 5 teenagers at an isolated lake house, you must kill all of them before time runs out.

There are 8 different killers to chose from, each with different abilities. Some killers are harder to play than others. The killer can never die but the game ends when time runs out.

Terror by the Lake is a thematic horror game that is designed to be a light game that you can play in a short period of time. With only a few components you can play almost anywhere.

Name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 4th Extension
Description:
This is the last extension for Clinic Deluxe Edition released for the non Essen fair in 2020.
It contains:
- 4 New player boards, called basement board printed both side Normal/Expert
- 9 New very special Double tiles printed both side
- A set of Rules

As a side note: Clinic Deluxe Edition - 2nd Extension and Clinic Deluxe Edition - 3rd Extension have been skipped by the designer because of lack of play testing during the lockdowns. They will be released later in 2021-2022.

So Clinic Deluxe Edition - 4th Extension will be the last expansion and will end the series.

Except it didn't!

Name: Monopoly: Ireland Edition
Description:
"Cead Mille Failte" to the Republic of Ireland edition of the great property board game Monopoly. 
Ireland is famous for its writers and poets such as James Joyce, Sean OiCasey, W.B. Yeats, and Seamus Heaney and its musicians, which include U2, Thin Lizzy and Boyzone. 
Sports such as horse racing, Grey hound racing and golf thrive, while Hurling, recognised as one of the fastest games in the world, and Gaelic Football are the national sports. 
Home of the shamrock, the Aran jumper, the "craic agus ceol" (fun and music) Ireland maintains its reputation of the "Land of the Welcomes".

—description from the back of the box

Name: Xeno-Force: Rulebook
Description:
Xeno-Force pits mankind’s finest marines against alien threats in a scenario driven fast play skirmish game. 
Battle your way past tough alien horrors to complete your mission. 
Play games in your favourite sci-fi universe with this flexible and detailed system. 
Xeno-Force is a scenario driven game. It is about using your games to tell interesting stories and building those stories.

This unique semi-cooperative game means you and your friends work together in a team against a single alien opponent to accomplish your objectives, but also compete to gain the most glory and honour.

Jump straight into the action with pre-generated characters and scenarios, or play as a longer campaign game, linking missions together to develop your own engaging story.

Xeno-Force rulebook includes:


     Detailed but straight forward game rules with lots of examples
     Three introductory scenarios with more on the website
     Full campaign and character development and advancement rules
     Six difference character classes with unique combat styles
     Tons of weapons, equipment and abilities
     Nine Xenotypes ( “Bugs” and “Cyborgs” etc.); pick one that suits your model collection
     Rules for vehicles


Full Advancement Rules:

     Xeno-Force allows you to advance your characters from mission to mission using a very thorough and detailed advancement system. Watch your characters grow in strength and develop through campaigns. Specialise them in different styles of combat so each one can become genuinely unique.


Use for RPGs:

     Xeno-Force works really well to support RPG games to run tactical missions when the players "call in the cavalry"


Full Support:

     The game is fully supported online, with missions and aliens published on the website.


Community:

     Please join in the community and share your experiences, questions and scenarios. The more players who join in the better.


—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Marvel Battleworld: Series 1 Thanos Ship Showdown
Description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Expanding the core game established with the Marvel Battleworld Battle Ball and Mega Packs, the Thanos Ship Showdown brings an exclusive Thanos character and his brutal flagship into the fight! Stop Thanos as he tries to distract and defeat your Heroes!

—description from the publisher

Name: Flucht aus dem Alltag
Description:
Driving to work, ironing, cooking - who does not know the feeling that everyday life is really absorbed and captured. In this unique escape game that is actually the case!

The exciting story takes the fellow players on a mysterious adventure full of tricky puzzles and encrypted codes. Only those who manage to solve all the tasks in the given time will ultimately be able to escape everyday life. But be careful: If you don't want to be misled here, you need ingenuity, creativity and the ability to work in a team.

The ultimate game for all puzzle lovers and escape fans.

Name: Flucht aus der Schule
Description:
It is the last day of school before the holidays. After a long nap in history class, you are shocked to find that you are suddenly sitting alone in the classroom - and all the doors to the outside are locked!

Why didn't anyone wake you up? And how do you escape on vacation now? You have to find out in this exciting escape game. Now you and your fellow players have to show talent for combination, creativity and team spirit in order to solve the encrypted messages and tricky puzzles in this game. And against time!
So get started right away! Who wants to spend their vacation at school?

Name: Locked Adventures: Der magische Fall II
Description:
After you have solved the riddle of the mysterious magical sleep, it quickly becomes clear to you: You now have to find Albert. But what is really hidden behind the call for help
Potions Master? Follow his magical trail and you will become London from one
get to know a completely new perspective. But hurry because you are not them
The only ones who are on Albert's heels. The time is running!

Name: Entkommen!: Die geheime Bibliothek
Description:
Locked up in the secret library.
A series of puzzles.
A locked door without a key.
60 minutes.
Can you "ESCAPE"?

Name: Catchup & Mousetard: Battle of the Sandwiches!
Description:
A family game about cooking, with "anisauces" as main characters (cats and mices fussioned with sauceboat) and funny faced ingredients to create sandwiches.

It's a roll & write game with a board and some character sheets.

Rolling a dice you advance the squares and collect the ingredients. You have to complete sandwiches and salads with these ingredients you're collecting.  The first character to cook the 5 proposed sandwiches faster than the others will became the winner.

Name: Why You Lying!: Duel
Description:
Why You Lying! is a party game based on the classic Liar's Dice gameplay with some hilarious twists: legs and wings!

In this game, each player has a deck of 30 Animal cards consisting of 5 each of Cricket, Spider, Fish, Chicken, Rabbit, and the almighty Mascot Worker!
Players shuffle their deck and draw 5 hand cards at the beginning of each round. The start player will announce whether they will play with legs or wings in the current round by saying "I bet there are X (number of) Y (animals) with Z (amount of) legs (or wings) among all animals in all players' hand cards."
And players take turns to raise the bet by increasing X, Y (animals' hierarchy), or Z, OR they can call the previous player BLUFF!

Play smart with the information in your hand, and play cunning when you raise the bet. But beware, don't let the Mascot Workers fool you!

Why You Lying! Duel is a small box with 2 decks of cards for 2 players to enjoy. You can also combine it with the base game to have a epic 5-6 players bluffing war!

Name: Armada: The Game of Epic Naval Warfare Rulebook
Description:
Armada is a tabletop game for two or more players. Choose your side and then command a fleet of Mantic miniatures to represent powerful navies such as the stoic and pious Basileans, or plot carnage and destruction with the rampaging orcs. With a range of beautiful ship models to choose from and many stories to tell, Armada is truly an amazing spectacle to play and witness.

The 96-page rulebook contains the core rules, 10 action-packed scenarios, and advanced rules for potentially devastating weather effects.

The rulebook is also contained in the Armada: Two Player Starter Set

—description from the publisher

Name: Second World War at Sea: Eastern Fleet – British Carriers
Description: In Eastern Fleet, there is significant historical disparity between the the strength of the British Eastern Fleet and the Japanese First Air Fleet.  This supplement seeks to increase the strength of the Eastern Fleet to allow for a more head to head assault.  The supplement comes with 25 new pieces (10 ship and 15 aircraft) and 4 new scenarios (2 operational and 2 battle).
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: CyberStrategy
Description:
CyberStrategy is an asymmetric, educational strategy board game in which 2 teams face each other: (1) a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) tries to protect the bank's corporate network and its assets with security measures and (2) one or more hackers attack it trying to reveal the master password.

The CISO wins when he successfully fends off the attacks and reveals the identity of the hackers (all hackers lost all 3 identity tokens) or the hackers run out of bitcoin to fund their operation. In the other case, the hacker with the highest individual score (bitcoin) wins; which creates some healthy paranoia amongst the hackers.

The CISO starts with (at least) one defence card ("security measure") per type of attack and a starting budget in euro. Each hacker starts with 3 attacks of their choice, 3 identity tokens, and a starting money stack in bitcoin.

Each player also has a hidden goal for the game, which - when completed - gives them a leg up.

The game plays in 3 phases per round:

(1) the EVENT phase: 
(a) the CISO receives his budgets (which depends on the number of hackers) and 
(b) both CISO and hackers draw an event card (which is resolved as indicated on the card)

(2) the PLANNING phase:
(a) the CISO can spend budget to purchase additional security measures (= draw cards) and can deploy security measures (= ready cards) 
(b) the hackers can learn additional attacks (= draw cards, up to a hand limit of 4) and can plan attacks  
 (3) the ATTACK phase: 
(a) the hackers declare (joint or separate) attacks on the assets of the bank, starting with the assets at the outer rim of the corporate infrastructure (ATM, router,...) and pay for the attack (in bitcoins)
(b) the CISO then checks if they security measures they put in play are sufficient to block the attack
=> if the attack succeeded (defence value is lower than total attack value), the asset is hacked and the hackers receive a bitcoin reward for the successful attack 
=> if the attack failed, the hacker leading the attack hands over 1 identity token to the CISO

Name: Flame Westward: The Third World War in Europe 1980s
Description:
The hypothetical WWIII game broke out in the 1980s, main scope is around the center of Europe. The rules are designed with Soviet military theory as the core. Designer has a wealth of research and insights into the Cold War.

Three scenarios:
1 Ð—Ð°Ð¿Ð°Ð´-81
2 Able Archer 83
3 Thermonuclear war

Simulation scale:
Unit: 
WP: composed of group armies, few airborne divisionsï¼Œand artillery divisions; 
NATO: mostly divisions and brigades.
Time: 1Turn = 2days
Space: 1Hex=50km

Name: Quizoo
Description:
It's a musical guessing game, but not as you know it! From "Ring of Fire" to "Despacito", see if you can hum these popular tunes into the kazoo for your teammates to guess.

Set contains: 4 kazoos, 100 songs and instruction card.

—description from the box

Name: Warfighter: Multi-Era Expansion #2 – Skills and Gear Cards!
Description:
"Infantry, Forward!"

Adds 112 Skill and Gear Cards to your Loadout!  This expansion provides cards for Modern Daylight, Modern Shadow War, Modern PMC, WWII Europe, WWII Pacific.

Name: One Small Step: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Lead the United States or Soviet Union Space Agency in this engine building, worker placement, race for the moon Eurogame.

Play on a team of one or two players where each player on a team controls either the Engineer Workers or the Administrator Workers for their team.

Coordinate your actions with your teammate on each of your turns to either place an Engineer or Administrator Worker on board actions to gather the games 9 different resources, draft development cards, increase your media coverage, recruit astronauts, upgrade resources, develop your space flight capability, or spend resources to launch humanity’s first unmanned and manned Missions into space.

Which type of Worker you place changes the effect that a board action has. Each board action can only be used once each round, so placing a Worker does not only prevent your opponents from using the action but prevents your teammate from using the action's alternative effect with their workers.

Gain the advantage in the media to place your worker first in a round or to gain a media bonus for special one time abilities and bonus resources.

Score Victory Points by building cards you drafted or by successfully launching Missions into space. Every successful launch you have upgrades one of the board actions not only for your team but also your opponents. Successfully launch enough Manned Missions to achieve the first manned moon landing before your rivals, gaining you bonus Victory Points and ending the game. The team who has the most Victory Points at the end contributed the most to one of humanities greatest achievements and wins the game.

One Small Step provides a fun learning experience about the space race that makes it perfect for a US history curriculum in the classroom and home school.

—description from the publisher


Deluxe edition also contains the Hidden Heroes and Mission Control expansions, along with additional miniatures.

Name: Sprytna Ośmiornica
Description:
Each player puts 3 tentacles on one hand's fingers and prepares his set of cups. The task card is drawn and players try to arrange their cups as pictures as fast as they can. First player to finish shouts "Game stop!" and takes the task card. The player who gets the most cards wins the game.

Contents:

     18 cups, 3 of each color (yellow, orange, green, navy blue, blue and red)
     9 octopus tentacles
     27 cards
     rules

Name: Counting Coup and Cutting Horses
Description:
A set of rules for wargaming in the Old West from 1700 to 1890 A.D..  Mechanics are fun, easy and innovative.  Suitable for solo, cooperative, or head to head play.

The focus is on inter tribal wars especially those of the Plains Indians.  But mountain men, rangers, cowboys, the regular U.S. army, Navahos, Apaches, and immigrant woodland and southeastern tribes are also covered.

The game is played with miniature figures of any scale.  A unique feature is the use of playing cards in place of dice to resolve game mechanics.  Players draw cards from a standard card deck, which is reshuffled periodically.  Cards determine activation, movement distances, the outcome of shooting or melee combat, and of pin and morale tests.  There are extensive notes on specific native American tribes and a system to play solo.

Name: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z – Stolen Fleets
Description:
The German Navy captured many enemy vessels, but placed none in service larger than a destroyer. In Plan Z: Stolen Fleets, the German Kriegsmarine adds battleships, aircraft carriers, cruisers and more taken from the French, Soviet and Dutch navies to its order of battle along with a few new German-built ships.

Stolen Fleets is an expansion for our Second World War at Sea: Plan Z, itself an expansion set based on the notorious but never-completed German Plan Z fleet expansion program. There are 80 new die cut, silky smooth playing pieces (60 doubled-sized ship pieces and 20 standard ones) and 30 additional scenarios extending the story of Plan Z.

Ships now steaming under German colors include the French battleship Richelieu, battle cruiser Strasbourg and aircraft carrier Joffre; the Soviet battleship Sovetsky Soyuz, battle cruiser Kronshtadt and heavy cruiser Kirov, and the Dutch cruiser Eendracht. And lots more. The Germans also add the H41-type super-battleships to their fleet and two more liners converted to aircraft carriers.

Requires Plan Z, Bismarck and Arctic Convoy to enjoy all of the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Broken Skies
Description:
Broken Skies is a game for two or more players. A standard game will generally consist of 2-3 models per side. Players first choose the faction they want to play and select a force up to the agreed points value.

When selecting your force, you start with selecting your aircraft. These may then be upgraded by adding pilot skills or aircraft upgrades. A player may choose a maximum of one Pilot Skill upgrade and one Aircraft upgrade for each model.

Broken Skies is all about fun customisation of your list to make it uniquely yours! Of course, you don’t have to customise with skills and upgrades. You can just take the basic model as listed on the stat card. These represent the basic rookie pilots that has yet to win glory in the skies.

With this in mind it’s also possible to play a series of friendly games in which your force builds their skills and upgrades over the course of the campaign.

Name: Shadows of Kilforth: Shadows of Pay Promo Cards
Description:
3 promotional cards shrink wrapped in 1565: St. Elmo's Pay â€“ The Great Siege of Malta.

3 cards that expand Shadows of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game:
Encounter: Ally (SEP1)
Encounter: Badlands (SEP2)
Encounter: Plains (SEP3)

Included in Gloom of Kilforth: Promo Pack 1

Name: 1066, Tears to Many Mothers: Promo Cards
Description:
1565, St. Elmo's Pay: Promo Pack also includes two brand new promo cards for the game 1066, Tears to Many Mothers: The Battle of Hastings.

1x Saxon Character (TP1) - Hereward the Wake - Fearsome: Destroy 1 non-Leader enemy in this card's Wedge.
1x Norman Character (TP2) - Richard FitzGilbert  - Fearsome: Destroy 1 non-Leader enemy in this card's Wedge.

Name: Trepidation: Horror card game
Description:
Trepidation is a cooperative horror survival game, where players are trying trying to make it to the end of the forest. All players are given a role card at the beginning of the game, which is broken down by the townspeople and the possessed role. Townspeople are trying to make it to the end of the forest, while the possessed player is trying to have everyone killed before they reach the end.

There are monsters and events standing in between you and your escape. Your survival will depend upon collecting and trading items, strategizing, and figuring out whom to trust in your party. Can you make it out of the forest alive?

Every player is dealt a limited number of location and item cards. The location cards are used throughout the game to progress through the forest. Each location card will indicate whether you will draw an item, event, or monster card for that turn.

There are unique location cards found within the deck called landmarks. The landmarks are what you will be searching for and must complete as a group to continue your progress through the forest. Depending on the difficulty you select at the beginning of the game, you will have to complete either 3, 5 or 7 landmarks to make it out of the forest. Planning ahead is a necessity, as the landmarks will force the entire party to combat monsters the moment they are played.

Every monster has a unique way that it must be warded off. Some monsters are more problematic, and even more perilous to come across than others. Use your items and plan ahead in order to overcome that which awaits you and your team.

Be careful, though, as the possessed player may try to deceive you. They can use the event, item and landmark cards to their advantage, and will try blending in as a normal towns person throughout the game... waiting until your guard is down before sabotaging you.

Name: Message in a Bottle
Description: Four bottles with messages are underway. On their trip they have to survive several whirlpools. You have to pay attention, if you want to know what has made it to the end!

Name: Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space – For Renegade Scout 2nd edition
Description:
Unity: Veteran Infantry of Unified Space is the first supplement for Renegade Scout 2nd edition introduces Veteran troops to your games.

This adds a new squad type for use in the Army Builder, along with notes on how they are incorporated into the normal section structure of your army. Veteran squads have a diverse array of weapons and access to additional abilities, making them perfect for that special, cool squad of miniatures you have or for kit-bashing a grim-faced squad of survivors.

The supplement also adds the option to add a veteran squad leader to most existing squads of infantry, adding a bit of personal touch as the wise old "Sarge" leads the fresh recruits into battle.

Finally, expanded background material helps put the new rules in context within the Unified Space setting.

The ..of Unified Space series is intending to be a series of small, bite-sized expansions for Renegade Scout 2nd edition, adding new content and options to the game system, expanding the universe and generally increasing the amount of fun to be had.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lottori
Description:
By a lake, in the garden, by the sea or in the forest - there's lots to discover in the company of these two elves. You must look carefully and memorize the motif in order to find the right tile to place on the the right board. Four beautifully illustrated scenes make up this lotto game that can be adapted for different age groups.  
An adventurous journey with the elves! A fun lotto game for 1-4 children, 3 years an up.

Name: Alphabeto
Description:
Who can say their ABC festest?
Children learn the alphabet in the twinkling of an eye. There is a clearly recognizable motif for each letter. In addition you can practice german reading.

Name: Fantastico
Description: Bords of a feather flock together, and the idea of Domino Fatastico is just a simple: You have to place two identical mofifs next to each other. Played alone or with others, hardly any other game is as versatile and variad as Fantastico. Younger players will love looking at the carefully chosen images and to describe them before starting to play. And for older children, there are amusing variations thyt guarantee exitement.

Name: The Square Watermelon Game
Description:
Equipment consists of a 7x7 board and watermelon shaped pieces in Green and Red. There are 24 pieces of each color.

The board starts off empty. Green goes first. For his first move, Green is not allowed to place any piece in the center space.

Players take turns placing a piece on any empty space. They are attempting to form squares using their tokens to mark the 4 corners of the square.  Squares can be any size and any orientation. Which sometimes makes them difficult to perceive. It is possible for a single piece to complete the corners of several different squares.

After a player sets a piece, they check to see if any new squares were formed. They make note of how many and keep a running total. A player is given a reasonable time to count up all the new squares, and then the next player may take his turn. If a player spots any new squares after the other players sets a piece, that player loses those points.

After the last piece is set, the scores are tallied. High score wins.

-description from designer

Name: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming
Description:
Welcome to Renegade Scout.

What is Renegade Scout? Other than 206 pages jammed full of gaming goodness?

This is a set of science fiction miniatures rules aimed at not only recapturing the spirit and feel of old school science fiction gaming, but presenting it in an updated and improved form, combining familiar mechanics with the polish and elegance expected in a modern game.

Using this system, you can command everything from tentacle aliens to squads of futuristic troopers, tanks, walkers, dinosaurs and more. Rules include off-map support, supernatural powers and a host of strange terrain features and world conditions to fight among.

If you are looking to revive some of your favorite old miniatures, note that Renegade Scout is profile compatible with the two first editions of the most popular gothic scifi wargame, allowing troops and weapons to be used as is, but with sleeker and more elegant mechanics.

If you want a fully fledged space opera setting to dive into, you can explore the worlds of Unified Space, where a host of alien species battle for supremacy, from the blood-stained cyborg troops of the Converted to the proud K'Erin and mysterious Engineers.

If you want to just open the book and play, we include 8 Battle Scenarios ready to play with your own armies, as well as the Objective Battle letting you fight an unpredictable encounter with randomly generated objectives. 
Scenario driven gaming more your speed? An array of tools and mechanics cover everything from radio communications to barricading doors.

The Army Builder allows you to construct a huge range of forces for any of the included troop types, for pick-up games using an army list and a fully fledged points system lets you build your own custom forces.

Want something a bit bigger? Why not start a Persistent Game where your troops gain experience from battle to battle. Perfect for campaigns or league play.

In short, almost whatever it is you are into and whatever scale of miniatures you enjoy, Renegade Scout has something for you.

Note that this is a fully updated 2nd edition of the rules, featuring much expanded content, material from several supplements, brand new options and far more pick-up-and-play possibilities than before.

If you are an experienced player, please enjoy this new edition generously funded by the fan base.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Socken suchen
Description:
Who is the fastest in searching for socks?
The children are rolling 3 die and try to find the sock with the correct combination of colours. The fastest child gets the sock and the ones with the most socks at the end of the game wins.

Name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Absolut knifflig!
Description: This is a tricky game for smart kids! They need to arrange 9 cards in a square so that all figures look correct. At the end, you should see a picture of Pippi Longstocking, Mr. Nilsson and the little uncle.

Name: Vario Tino
Description: The dwarf Tino and his frieds love colours. They each like to dress in one colour, and that should be different from everybody else's. Item for Item, they collect their clothes - mostly from the nice clean ones hanging on the washing line. The search for the right colour is made more exiting because it can only be seen when a foil is laid over the item of clothing. Now, from the three basic colours ther are many more mixed colours.

Name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Südsee-Wirbel
Description: A cool jump & run game with Pippi and her friends.

Name: Castelino
Description:
A magnificent feast is to be held at the great royal palace. All of you, princes and princesses, from all corners of the kingdom, are invited! But hurry, because everyone has to gather the in the palace grounds before the king himself arrives.

The main focus of this game is on the recognition and matching of the basic colours and an early understanding of rules.

Name: Pizza Fiesta
Description:
The aim of this game is to top your pizza base with all the correct ingredients first. There is another game variant where you'd need to be the first one to collect four pizza cards as quickly as possible. 
Pizza fiesta contains many more variants - all of them fun to play and at the same time requiring full attention and responsiveness!

Name: XXL-Candy
Description: Concentrazion and quick reactions are needed here. This exciting game of sweets promotes powers of observation and colour combination recognition.

Name: Raupenalarm
Description: Every year Moritz and his friends can hardly wait until the delicious apples are finally ripe in Grandma's garden. However, the caterpillars are as impatient as them. As soon as the apples fall off the trees, a race begins and Moritz and his friends need a bit of luck to win!

Name: Ritter Trenk: Burgbau zu Hohenlob
Description: Stake the cards as high as you can! The castle will become a powerful fortress in this way. But be careful, the higher it gets, the more probable it is that the castle will collapse...

Name: Muffelfurzwildes Wettrennen
Description: The turtle overtook the snail! It's important that you put your cards in a good order so that your animals are the first ones!

Name: Zug um Zug
Description:
This game belongs to a series of three Selecta games for kids and adults where planning, combination, evaluating and deciding are important.
Every token is put on one of the eight fields. Step by step the player gets nearer to the correct order of the tokens.

Name: Neun Freunde
Description: Many friends want to come to the gathering in the middle of the board. But some start too late, some are stopped by the other players and some are removed from the game. The gathering starts, when nine friends are there!

Name: Vines in Bloom
Description:
Vines in Bloom is a tile-laying game with the goal of growing and branching your vine to have the most flowers in bloom by the end of the game.

As vines grow, they will split and compete for space on the board. When vines get entangled, your blossoms might get eliminated and removed from the game.

Grow your vine strategically to maximize the number of blossoms you get, balancing how much you want to grow and how many blossoms you want to keep safe, instead.

The game can be played from 1 up to 4 players.

Gameplay:
- Your goal is to grow and keep the most blossoms by the end of the game.
- Two tiles from your hand must be passed to the next player. You can use the rest to grow your vine.
- By branching, you gain blossoms, while also getting more connection points for future tiles.
- As the board fills, competing vines converge and can remove other player's blossoms.
- Single blossom tiles keep a blossom safe from removal, but also prevent that branch from growing further.
- Triple blossoms earn an extra point, give protection, and increase the number of tiles you can place each turn.
- At the end of your turn, draw tiles back up to your hand limit.

-description from designer

Name: Boston Against The World: Sports Trivia Game
Description:
Boston Against the World is the sports trivia game for Boston's biggest sports fans. 
Take turns against one or more players -- or better yet, make teams -- to see who can come up with answers from each card's list of Boston or World sports trivia. It's the perfect gift for EVERYONE who grew up following Boston sports, with questions that every sports fan can relate to!

Players roll custom dice to determine category — Boston or World — and how many answers they’ll need to score points.

First player or team to 21 wins.

Name: Wildes Olchi-Würfeln
Description: The players role the 2 die one after the other and wipe off the olchis they throw.
Families: Creatures: Die Olchis (designed by Erhard Dietl)

Name: Häschen würfeln
Description: The players role the 2 die one after the other and wipe off the cute bunnies they throw.

Name: Wilderness Survival School
Description:
A game of survival and exploration, for 1 - 4 players (ages 10 and up), by Steadman Watson

As a student of the Vildhall School of Wilderness Survival, you and your friends learn valuable survival skills. Now it is time to put those skills to the test on a wilderness adventure. Grab your pack, fill your canteen, check your compass and let’s head out on an adventure!

The objective of Wilderness Survival School is to make it back to town with the highest Karma score, which represents how well each player’s adventure went overall.

Each player holds cards representing the courses they have completed, which enable specific feats of outdoor survival.  There are four foundation course feats available to all players: Fire Making, River Fording, Route Finding, and Shelter Building.  In addition, each player selects two elective feats.  Feats are not always successful, and players roll dice to determine how they did.

Before setting out on an adventure, each player fills their Day Pack with various supplies, keeping in mind the equipment requirements for chosen feats.

Each player has their own scorepad to track their vital statistics.  Every player starts with the same amount of Health Points, Energy, and Karma.  Health Points is the capacity to absorb damage, Energy is the capacity to take actions, and Karma is the sum of a player’s actions, both good and bad.

Each day is broken down into 6 turns, which are tracked using a turn tracker.  Turns 1 - 4 are in the daylight, while turns 5 and 6 are at night.  Movement and feats are undertaken during the day, while the night is used to recover Energy.

As players move, they will explore nearby terrain (moving meeples) and gradually expand the map.  The map is composed of hexagon tiles; new tiles are placed by the players using simple rules and the map is different each time the game is played.  Moving through the wilderness is how players will have wildlife encounters, locate additional food and water, and eventually find the way back to town.

The game ends as soon as all players make it back to town. Once everyone is back, the players tally up their Karma (including any of the secret objectives found on the foundation feat cards).

Whoever has the highest Karma score wins!

—description from the desinger

Name: Társasház
Description:
This is a deduction party game for 3-5 persons, offering  30-45 minutes playing time.

A group of novice detectives are deployed to a condominium where every tenant is likely to be a crook. Each detective receives a description of a certain suspect, and their task is to find their target person in one of the apartments. The player who is first to succeed wins the game.

One of the players takes the role of the Game Master, acting for the tenants. The rest of the players compete with each other in the investigation, which must be done by questioning the tenants. However, as they all have something to hide, they may be willing to give some bits of information on their neighbors only, and never about themselves.

All the detectives receive a police file with a suspect’s description, a dozen question cards, a player aid used for deduction, and some cash which might come in useful to make people talk. In their turn, the detectives knock on a door of their choice and ask a few selected questions by playing their question cards. Their ultimate goal is to locate the suspect by deduction, based on the answers they get during the game.

When a player asks a question about the occupant of a certain apartment, the Game Master checks the back of the relevant door card (visible only to him/her), and tells the answer based on the 12 data found there. But as the answer will be heard by all the players, everyone can note it down and use it for their own progress! Door cards are placed on the table randomly. Not knowing which tenants the detectives will be looking for, the Game Master is not in the position to give hints. But his or her spirited answers can make this party game great fun for everyone!
				
				
					============Description in Hungarian:

A Társasház 3-5 személy számára ajánlott dedukciós partijáték, mely kb. 30-45 percig tart.

A rendÅ‘rfÅ‘nök egy csapat kezdÅ‘ nyomozót ráállít egy társasházra, ahol csupa gyanús alak és körözött bÅ±nözÅ‘ él. Mindannyian kapnak egy-egy személyleírást, és ennek alapján kell megtalálniuk a maguk emberét a sok egyforma ajtó mögött. Akinek ez elsÅ‘ként sikerül, az nyeri a játékot.

Az egyik játékos játékmesterként vesz részt, Å‘ személyesíti meg a ház lakóit, a többiek nyomoznak, egymással versengve.
Az utasítás értelmében a nyomozást a lakók kikérdezésével kell lefolytatni. Csakhogy ebben a házban minden lakónak van rejtegetni valója, ezért legfeljebb a szomszédairól hajlandó elárulni pár lényegtelennek vélt információt.

Minden nyomozó kap egy-egy rendÅ‘rségi aktát egy személyleírással, egy tucat kérdéskártyával, egy információs segédlettel, valamint némi készpénzzel arra az esetre, ha egyeseket csak vesztegetéssel lehet rábírni az együttmÅ±ködésre. A nyomozó játékosok feladata, hogy minden körben bekopogtassanak egy lakásba, feltegyenek néhány jól megválasztott kérdést a kérdéskártyáik kijátszásával, majd a kapott válaszokból a játék során kikövetkeztessék, melyik ajtó mögött bujkál az álaluk keresett személy.

A válaszokat a játékmester adja meg: a játék elején véletlenszerÅ±en lehelyezett ajtókártyák túloldalán – csak számára láthatóan – megtalálható mind a 12 lehetséges válasz. A kérdéseket és a válaszokat azonban mindenki hallja, így azokat más játékos is lejegyezheti, felhasználhatja!  Mivel a játékmester elÅ‘tt is titok, ki melyik lakót keresi, segíteni még akaratlanul sem tud. Ellenben Å‘ és a válaszai adják meg a játék igazi hangulatát!

Name: Souvenirs
Description:
Souvenirs is a card game in which players collect valuable collections of travel souvenirs. 
There is a row of open souvenir cards on the table (one card more than there are players in the game). Each player has a set of hand cards. In each turn, players select a hand card that marks the souvenir they would like to collect. Cards are revealed simultaneously. If a player was the only one who chose a certain souvenir, they can collect it; the unclaimed souvenirs are cleared and can reappear later. When a player has collected a certain set of souvenirs, they can claim a mission card. 
At the end of the game (when there aren't enough souvenirs left for a new round, or when all mission cards are claimed. 
Scoring is for each souvenir, for claimed mission cards and for certain preferences of each player (each player has a favorite continent, for example). Highes score wins.

Name: AuZtralia: TaZmania
Description:
In AuZtralia, humanity came to build a new world after a long war against the Old Ones. They failed. The old terrors were waiting for them and pushed them back to the coast. Now their only hope lies in a nearby small island, TaZmania. Will this be the promised land?

AuZtralia: TaZmania is a dual-map expansion for AuZtralia designed specifically for 1-2 players, or (if playing with the Revenge of the Old Ones expansion) three players. One side has a fixed map that is surveyed for resources and Old Ones, while the other side is randomized through a set of 66 terrain tiles.

This expansion also includes a solo campaign mode that can be played on the new TaZmanian maps or on the original maps.

Name: Flames of War: British Starter Force – British Desert Rats Squadron
Description:
The armoured squadron is the strike force of the British Army. 
With their exceptionally fast Cromwell tanks, the Desert Rats have the ability to rapidly strike the enemy rear area and relentlessly pursue the slower enemy forces. 
This speed allows the armoured squadron to continually work around to the weaker flanks of enemy formations, always striking from the side rather than slogging their way up the middle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Kingpin
Description:
Wilson Fisk is a criminal mastermind and the single most feared, dangerous, and powerful crime lord in New York City. From humble beginnings as a poor street thug, Fisk used his genius intellect, physical strength, and sheer ruthlessness to remove all rivals and become the unseen ruler of all organized crime in the city.

As the Kingpin, Fisk is a master manipulator, controlling events to increase his power and the reach of his criminal empire. When an example has to be made, the Kingpin uses his enormous strength and skills in the martial arts to utterly crush his foes in physical combat. Counting the likes of Spider-Man, Daredevil, and the Punisher among his long list of enemies, the Kingpin has no qualms in exploiting his adversary’s principles to usher their destruction.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Bullseye & Daredevil
Description:
As a boy, Matt Murdock was blinded in an accident involving radioactive chemicals. Though he could no longer see, the chemicals heightened Murdock’s other senses and imbued him with an incredible 360-degree radar sense. With years of martial arts training under the ninja master Stick and fueled by a relentless pursuit of justice, Matt Murdock protects the innocent of Hell’s Kitchen as Daredevil, the Man Without Fear!

A psychopathic assassin, Bullseye is one of the deadliest men in the world. Beyond his superb skills in hand-to-hand combat, Bullseye was born with the innate ability to throw any projectile with lethal force and accuracy. As a costumed criminal, Bullseye has crossed paths with many of the world’s greatest heroes, but he holds a special hatred for his nemesis, Daredevil, stopping at nothing to put him down once and for all.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Punisher & Taskmaster
Description:
Frank Castle was a former Marine just trying to pick up a normal life with the family he loved. But when that family was murdered, Frank swore to avenge them by punishing those who hurt the innocent. Proficient in close quarters combat, a trained marksman, and an explosives expert, Frank now stalks the mean streets delivering his own brand of personal justice as the Punisher.

When Anthony Masters injected himself with an experimental serum designed to unlock the brain’s procedural memory potential, he gained the ability to instantly replicate the physical movement of anyone he saw. Using these photographic reflexes, Masters took on the name Taskmaster and became a mercenary, selling his skills to the highest bidder. Thanks to his Mnemonic Memory, Taskmaster is able to memorize, utilize, and predict the attacks of any opponent, turning their own physical abilities against them.

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Arena Mortis
Description:
Warhammer Underworlds meets fast-paced multiplayer combat in Arena Mortis – an expansion that transforms the ultimate competitive miniatures game into a furious free-for-all!

This boxed set lets you transform your Warhammer Underworlds collection into a new kind of game. Picking your favourite hero, you'll embark on arena battles that are fast paced, fun and that'll push your Warhammer Underworlds skills to the limit!

Includes:
- 20 all-new Gambit cards – designed for Arena Mortis but usable in ANY of your games
- 20 all-new Upgrade cards – also usable in ordinary games of Warhammer Underworlds
- A double-sided game board to play on, compatible with all existing Warhammer Underworlds boards
- Tokens and Cards for keeping track of the game
- Updated cards for the Restless Dead gambit and the Sepulchral Warden, reprinted for your convenience incorporating the latest rules updates

-description from the publisher's website

Name: The Brady Bunch Game
Description:
Player spins and moves along his path according to the number they spun. When a player comes to an obstacle on his trail, he must pit it up and go to the red space on his trail and throw the obstacle into the trash barrel. Once the trail is clear, the player picks up his numbered tent and according to the spinner on his turn, advances toward his campsite. He must spin the exact number to land on his campsite. The winner is the first player to get his tent to his campsite.

Content: Gameboard, 6 playing pieces, bases, 16 obstacles, 4 plastic tents, spinner, rules sheet.

Name: Mothership: Booster Pack
Description:
The content Booster Pack is all about beefing up the card count and adding even more variety to Mothership. The pack includes:

27x Action Cards (6x Holo Cards)
8x Artifacts Cards
8x Artifact Tokens
6x Class Cards
30x Distress Beacons Cards
10x Development Cards
10x Objective Cards
2x Celestial Hazards
2x City Planets + Stands

Also comes with blank cards for custom content:

8x Blank Action cards
8x Blank Class cards
8x Blank Distress beacons
8x Blank Objectives
8x Blank Developments
8x Blank Artifacts and Blank Tokens

Name: Middle-Earth Strategy Battle Game: Quest of the Ringbearer
Description:
The last days of the Third Age of Middle-earth may have been dominated by the many great battles fought during the climactic War of the Ring, yet the most seismic event of all was the destruction of the One Ring and the final defeat of the Dark Lord Sauron. Crucial to this lasting victory over the forces of darkness was the epic journey undertaken by the Nine Walkers – the Fellowship of the Ring – for the deeds of its members, both good and ill, were destined to rule the fate of all.

This expansion for the Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game brings the fateful quest of the Fellowship of the Ring to life. As well as background on where the Fellowship’s journey took them and vivid descriptions of the the many trials and tribulations they faced along the way, the book features a wealth of new rules, Scenarios and profiles. There are also rules for a linked, 28-scenario campaign that enables you to refight every key engagement involving the Fellowship and its members – from the smallest skirmish to the largest battle – with your collection of Citadel and Forge World miniatures.

Inside this 128-page hardback supplement, you will find:

Scenarios: 28 Narrative Scenarios, from the very start of Frodo's journey in Farmer Maggot's crop in the Shire, right through to the destruction of the One Ring in the fire of Mount Doom.

The Journey of the Ringbearer: Rules for linking the Narrative Scenarios together into a flowing campaign, with each battle having an impact on others. These include rules to represent the length of the journey, your Heroes being injured (or even dying!), and recovering their strength between encounters with the enemy.

Armies: Detailed army focuses, including the strengths, weaknesses and key models for five Armies: The Fellowship, Rangers of Ithilien, Wanderers in The Wild, The Black Riders and Cirith Ungol. Also includes two new profiles for the Rangers of Ithilien list, and two for the Wanders in the Wild list.

Legendary Legions: Rules for six new and updated Legendary Legions: The Breaking of the Fellowship, Rangers of Ithilien, Lurtz's Scouts, Depths of Moria, The Black Riders, and Cirith Ungol.

Fantasy Fellowship: Guidelines for creating your own Fantasy Fellowship by assembling Heroes from across Middle-earth in a similar way to the actual Fellowship of the Ring, but accounting for numerous 'what ifs' that could have reasonably happened throughout Middle-earth's and The One Ring's history. Includes rules for selecting a Ringbearer, their Companion, and the rest of The Fellowship. Also provides a slightly revised Fantasy Fellowship campaign, consisting of 23 linked Scenarios. (Please note that you will need the War in Rohan and Gondor at War supplements to be able to play all the way through the scenarios featured in the Fantasy Fellowship campaign.)

Weathertop Masterclass: An extended masterclass on how to best build and paint the Weathertop scenery piece, available on ForgeWorld.co.uk, which was a key location on Frodo's journey.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: The Best of White Dwarf Magazine
Description:
Ever since the Strategy Battle Game burst onto the scene way back in 2001, White Dwarf had featured regular content from Middle-earth – from Battle Reports and tactica to stage-by-stage modelling and painting guides, and even bespoke Scenarios. This supplement includes a collection of the very best Middle-earth articles to grace the pages of White Dwarf over the years. Whether you're a newer player looking to catch up on some classic articles or a veteran who’s after all the best content collated into a single publication, it’s got something for everyone!

This 128-page hardback supplement includes the following classic White Dwarf articles:


     Orcs Attack! (White Dwarf 263)
     Flight to Freedom (White Dwarf 396)
     The Battle for Erebor (White Dwarf December 2017)
     The Battle of Pelennor Fields (White Dwarf September 2018)
     A Clash of Companies (White Dwarf April 2019)
     The Search for the Stone (White Dwarfs January and February 2018)
     Duel of Zirakzigil (White Dwarf 281)
     Fiends and Fireworks (White Dwarf 309)
     Fatty Bolger's Great Escape (White Dwarf 311)
     The Hunt for Gollum (White Dwarf 302)
     Warg Chase in the Wilderness (White Dwarf September 2017)
     The Bigger they Are... (White Dwarf 307)
     The Brown Wizard (White Dwarf April 2018)
     River Assault Rules (White Dwarf 294)
     War of the Long Lake (White Dwarf April 2017)
     Armies of Middle-earth (White Dwarf November 2018)
     Magic of Middle-earth (White Dwarf December 2018)
     Modelling Workshop – Mordor Terrain (White Dwarf 344)
     Flight of the Nazgûl (White Dwarf 365)
     Paint Splatter – Théoden, King of Rohan (White Dwarf September 2018)
     Paint Splatter – Gandalf the White and Pippin (White Dwarf December 2018)


—description from the publisher

Name: Slappy Camper
Description:
Race to pack up your camper! You must think on your toes to slap the right camping gear, but watch out – slap the wrong card and you may find yourself unpacking! Be the first to fill your camper to win this game of quick reflexes and creative problem-solving.

EASY TO PLAY: Flip the cards to see what camping gear you can pack next, then use your marshmallow slappers to smack the matching card on the table! Be the first to fill your camper with no extra spaces.

Name: Ryd bordet
Description:
All the picture cards are spread on the table and one player reads a topic aloud. Eech player tries to collect all the picture cards that directly or indirectly relate to the subject. The opponents must approve the cards other players have collected, so they need to be able to vouch for their cards. The player who has finally collected the most picture cards has won.

Contains:

     150 tasks,
     150 picture cards
     1 hourglass
     rules

Name: Gæt
Description: The participants are tested in their knowledge of toys, children's songs, cartoon characters, superheroes, fairy tale characters and animals. The game consists of a series of cards in 6 different categories, where each card has five clues and an answer. For the individual participant, it is important to guess the correct answer with as few clues as possible. The fewer clues you use, the more fields you can  move. For each correct answer, you can either move your own piece forward on the game board, or perhaps choose to move your opponent back. The one who gets around the record the fastest has won.

Name: Princess
Description: The princesses want to avoid that, so the game is therefore about getting all the princesses home to the castle so they can prevent the dragon from ruining the party. Princesse is a new exciting adventure game where players must complete the tasks together. Ride the princesses home to the castle without bumping into the fire-breathing dragon. You win or lose together. The game teaches participants about cooperation through simple rules and simple game mechanisms. Can you work together and help the princesses back to the castle before it's too late?

Name: Spotlight Slam
Description: One player acts and others guess. When the others guess what the acting player is portraying, they try to snatch the right card from the table by smashing it with clubs. The fastest smasher gets the card. First player to collect 5 cards wins!

Name: Swip'Sheep
Description: Each player receives 3 cards. The rest are put to one side. Each player secretly gives one of their cards to the player on their left, and another to the player on their right. When all the players have 3 cards in their hand again, the first player says: "Are there any wolves around this evening?". All the players with a "wolf" card in their hand place it down in front of them. Each "wolf" card equals one attack. Any player with more than one "wolf" card, can attack the same player or different players. Working clockwise, any players who have placed down a "wolf" card now have to attack another player! To attack, the player has to put the "wolf" card in front of another player. If the player being attacked does have a "dog" card, they defend themselves and turn the attack against the wolf, otherwise the wolf attacks, and steals a card from the player's hand at random. The thieves keep the stolen cards in their hand. The used "wolf" and "dog" cards are put to one side. When all of the wolf attacks are over, each player reveals the cards they still have in their hand. The players keep their "sheep" cards to one side. These will ear them points at the end of the game. All the "wolf" and "dog" cards are put back into the deck of remaining cards and a new round begins. When all the rounds have been played, each player counts the number of sheep on their cards.

Name: The One
Description:
The personality card game that answers the question everyone wants to know but no one wants to ask, "Which ONE am I in the group?" Get together with some friends and find out what you really think of each other.

The One is the ultimate game to test your friendship group. How well do you really know each other? What stories are hidden deep within that are bursting to come out? Allow this game to help that process.

Are you a plus or a minus?
Are you a bonus or a burden?
Which ONE are you?
