Each card has a different personality. Some are positives and some are negatives. Players discuss who best suits 'THE ONE' on each card and must agree on ONE player to receive that card. Every card must be given and there is no limit on the amount of cards a player can receive. When all the cards have been handed out, the player with the highest score is the winner - THE ONE!

—description from the designer

Name: quizzone SKILLS
Description: In Quizzone Skills, players compete in various skills. Compete on time in categories such as words, maths, letters, songs, puzzles and more. The players take turns reading out questions that the other players answer. All players are involved in all questions, so there is speed across the field once the game starts. How to win: A certain number of rounds are played, depending on how many players are involved. Every time you answer correctly, you get a point chip. After the last round, the number of points is calculated. The player with the most pieces is the winner of the game.

Name: Banditti
Description: Where is the loot hidden? Sausage in the bedroom? Money in the bathroom? Each player receives a robber's house complete with floors, side walls and roof parts for a total of three floors and five loot chips of one color, which he can distribute in his rooms. You roll the dice: For each thrown robber sack you can ask a fellow player a yes / no question about an object; for two or three you can always ask the same player or a different player every time. For a gift as a result you can ask for an item from a player. If you have asked or requested correctly, you receive the chip and place it on your robber's bag. Whoever has collected any five items wins.

Name: Got Grits?
Description:
You and your pardner find yourselves having a little disagreement. Before you know it, you’re out under the high noon sun on dusty mainstreet, near 20 paces apart, half the town out watching and a mighty silence in the air.

“Alright,” you say, and spit in the dust, “let’s figure this’n out.”

Only natural you’re both real twitchy about now. You’re putting moves on each other, fake draws, designed to rile each other up like a scorpion in a bedroll.

Draw your hands simultaneously, with digits in some arrangement as to signify a 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5.

The player whose number is 1-2 higher will win that round and score a point.

1 beats 4,5
2 beats 5,1
3 beats 1,2
4 beats 2,3
5 beats 3,4

These points are your nerve, or grit. The player with the best nerve will make the best shot, naturally.

The time o’ reckoning comes along when both players throw matching digits.

So do the math, the player with the most grits makes a clean shot.

You decide, do you put a warning into their shoulder or hamstring n’ set their noodle straight, or whistle it real close past their ear like a mosquito or, hell, clean through the top of their hat -that’ll surely send them hightailing out over the arroyo.

Either way it seems that settled things and you figure you’ll both be close as ever, until the next time anyhow.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhorn
Description:
Heed the mighty WARHORN and charge into battle! Warhorn is a fast-paced timed deck-building battle game where horned creatures from the same clan grant cumulative power values of creatures or that creatures clan members that charge into battle. Warhorn has a companion mobile application where players access the WARHORN which is a digital timer that has large buttons where time can be added and subtracted when prompted by certain clan abilities.

When the war horn sounds players unleash their army (play their deck in its current state) trying to deploy their entire army of creatures as efficiently as possible by matching clans in a bid then match or exceed clash. Players whose clan cards are “defeated” go back into the Discharge pile which is later shuffled to create the communal Draft pile.

During the Draft Players will use their time as they see fit to build up their current army for crushing victories, sabotage, and Interfere with their opponents draft or diversify their forces for varied strategic outcomes.

Players may choose to stall during their turn and run down the clock in order to gain strategic advantages forcing other players to play clan abilities to force a turn pass, add or subtract time to or from the Warhorn, or ultimately cause the WARHORN to sound.

Players can choose to hold onto creature cards to create an active hand while the WARHORN is ticking down and Interfere with their opponents all while attempting to adapt to the clans drawn during their turn in order to build a powerful army deck from the communal drafting pile.

Clan cards will have different amounts of troops on them complimenting their clan abilities. The first player to deploy all their creature cards into the fight wins the battle. The first player to win 3 battles wins the war.

—description from the designer

Name: The Dragon & Flagon: The Brew that is True
Description:
Dragon and Flagon is a chaotic, fantasy tavern brawl where adventurers of all kinds battle their way to glory in the bar fight to end all bar fights. Each character has their own set of abilities that they can program into their action queue to help them come out of the battle with a glowing reputation. The Brew That is True expansion includes three new additions to the game—nine new characters with unique capabilities, magical potions with a variety of wild and unpredictable effects, and bookshelves that can be sent toppling and change the layout of the bar entirely! All the components of this expansion can be mixed and matched as desired with everything from the original Dragon and Flagon!

—description from the publisher

Name: MonstroCity: Rampage Expansion
Description:
The MonstroCity Rampage Expansion introduce 6 new exciting Monsters, new reinforcement cards and a new challenging way of playing the game, the Scenarios.

The expansion has 4 Different Scenarios: 
-Retrieve Monster DNA
-Mystery Formula
-Rescue Maddie Newton
-Dr Spotnik Demise.

Each scenario has different goal, different setup, extra rules that affect gameplay and new victory conditions.

Each game session takes 20 to 30 minutes, depending on the number of players.

-description from publisher
